title: "Hands-on Exercise 1"

  eval: true

  freeze: true

## Description

Learning to import data, displaying and modifying shapefiles in R.

### Changelog

19 Aug 24: Completed Hands-on Exercise 2

26 Aug 24: Updated the description and added a changelog.

## Importing Geospatial Data

Load *sf* and *tidyverse* packages into R environment.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(sf, tidyverse)
```
:::


Import geospatial data into R environment:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz = st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `C:\0SMU\IS415-GAA\Hands-on_Ex\Hands-on_Ex01\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cyclingpath = st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", layer = "CyclingPathGazette")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `CyclingPathGazette' from data source 
  `C:\0SMU\IS415-GAA\Hands-on_Ex\Hands-on_Ex01\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 3138 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: MULTILINESTRING
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 11854.32 ymin: 28347.98 xmax: 42644.17 ymax: 48948.15
Projected CRS: SVY21
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
preschool = st_read("data/geospatial/PreSchoolsLocation.kml")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `PRESCHOOLS_LOCATION' from data source 
  `C:\0SMU\IS415-GAA\Hands-on_Ex\Hands-on_Ex01\data\geospatial\PreSchoolsLocation.kml' 
  using driver `KML'
Simple feature collection with 2290 features and 2 fields

Dimension:     XYZ
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6878 ymin: 1.247759 xmax: 103.9897 ymax: 1.462134
z_range:       zmin: 0 zmax: 0
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```


:::
:::


## Checking the Content of a Simple Feature Data Frame

Using *st_geometry* to display the geometry list-column:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
st_geometry(mpsz)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Geometry set for 323 features 
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21
First 5 geometries:
```

## Plotting Geospatial Data

Plotting all data of the "Master Plan 2014":


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(mpsz)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: plotting the first 9 out of 15 attributes; use max.plot = 15 to plot
all
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Plotting only the geometry:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(st_geometry(mpsz))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Plotting only "*PLN_AREA_N"*:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(mpsz["PLN_AREA_N"])
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Working with Projection

### Assigning EPSG code

Showing the coordinate reference system (*crs*) of the "Master Plan 2014":


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
st_crs(mpsz)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Coordinate Reference System:
  User input: SVY21 
  wkt:
PROJCRS["SVY21",
    BASEGEOGCRS["SVY21[WGS84]",
        DATUM["World Geodetic System 1984",
            ELLIPSOID["WGS 84",6378137,298.257223563,
                LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]],
            ID["EPSG",6326]],
        PRIMEM["Greenwich",0,
            ANGLEUNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433]]],
    CONVERSION["unnamed",
        METHOD["Transverse Mercator",
            ID["EPSG",9807]],
        PARAMETER["Latitude of natural origin",1.36666666666667,
            ANGLEUNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8801]],
        PARAMETER["Longitude of natural origin",103.833333333333,
            ANGLEUNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8802]],
        PARAMETER["Scale factor at natural origin",1,
            SCALEUNIT["unity",1],
            ID["EPSG",8805]],
        PARAMETER["False easting",28001.642,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8806]],
        PARAMETER["False northing",38744.572,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8807]]],
    CS[Cartesian,2],
        AXIS["(E)",east,
            ORDER[1],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1,
                ID["EPSG",9001]]],
        AXIS["(N)",north,
            ORDER[2],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1,
                ID["EPSG",9001]]]]
```


:::
:::


Reassigning the EPSG code to 3414:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz3414 <- st_set_crs(mpsz, 3414)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: st_crs<- : replacing crs does not reproject data; use st_transform for
that
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
st_crs(mpsz3414)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Coordinate Reference System:
  User input: EPSG:3414 
  wkt:
PROJCRS["SVY21 / Singapore TM",
    BASEGEOGCRS["SVY21",
        DATUM["SVY21",
            ELLIPSOID["WGS 84",6378137,298.257223563,
                LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]]],
        PRIMEM["Greenwich",0,
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433]],
        ID["EPSG",4757]],
    CONVERSION["Singapore Transverse Mercator",
        METHOD["Transverse Mercator",
            ID["EPSG",9807]],
        PARAMETER["Latitude of natural origin",1.36666666666667,
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8801]],
        PARAMETER["Longitude of natural origin",103.833333333333,
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8802]],
        PARAMETER["Scale factor at natural origin",1,
            SCALEUNIT["unity",1],
            ID["EPSG",8805]],
        PARAMETER["False easting",28001.642,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8806]],
        PARAMETER["False northing",38744.572,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8807]]],
    CS[Cartesian,2],
        AXIS["northing (N)",north,
            ORDER[1],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]],
        AXIS["easting (E)",east,
            ORDER[2],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]],
    USAGE[
        SCOPE["Cadastre, engineering survey, topographic mapping."],
        AREA["Singapore - onshore and offshore."],
        BBOX[1.13,103.59,1.47,104.07]],
    ID["EPSG",3414]]
```


:::
:::


### Transform projection (from wgs84 to svy21)

Using *st_transform* to transform preschool crs to 3414:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
preschool3414 <- st_transform(preschool, crs = 3414)
st_geometry(preschool3414)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Geometry set for 2290 features 
Geometry type: POINT
Dimension:     XYZ
Bounding box:  xmin: 11810.03 ymin: 25596.33 xmax: 45404.24 ymax: 49300.88
z_range:       zmin: 0 zmax: 0
Projected CRS: SVY21 / Singapore TM
First 5 geometries:
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```

```


## Importing and Converting Aspatial Data

Import and list aspatial data from csv file:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
listings <- read_csv("data/aspatial/listings.csv")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Rows: 402 Columns: 18
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr   (4): name, host_name, neighbourhood, room_type
dbl  (11): id, host_id, latitude, longitude, price, minimum_nights, number_o...
lgl   (2): neighbourhood_group, license
date  (1): last_review

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
list(listings)
```


:::

Creating a simple feature data frame from *listings*:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
listings_sf <- st_as_sf(listings, coords = c("longitude","latitude"), crs=4326) %>%
  st_transform(crs=3414)

glimpse(listings_sf)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Rows: 402
Columns: 17
$ id                             <dbl> 2992450, 3820211, 5651579, 6623339, 803…
$ name                           <chr> "Luxury 2 bedroom apartment", "Restored…
```

## Geoprocessing with sf package

### Buffering

**The scenario**: The authority is planning to upgrade the exiting cycling path. To do so, they need to acquire 5 metres of reserved land on the both sides of the current cycling path. You are tasked to determine the extend of the land need to be acquired and their total area.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
buffer_cycling <- st_buffer(cyclingpath, dist=5, nQuadSegs=30)
buffer_cycling$AREA <- st_area(buffer_cycling)
sum(buffer_cycling$AREA)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
2218855 [m^2]
```


:::
:::


### Point-in-polygon count

**The scenario**: A pre-school service group want to find out the numbers of pre-schools in each Planning Subzone.

Identify pre-schools located in each planning subzone using *st_intersects* and *length* to get the number of pre-schools in each subzone.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz3414$`PreSch Count` <- lengths(st_intersects(mpsz3414, preschool3414))
summary(mpsz3414$`PreSch Count`)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
   0.00    0.00    4.00    7.09   10.00   72.00 
```


:::
:::


Use *top_n* to list the planning zone with most number of pre-schools.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
top_n(mpsz3414, 1, `PreSch Count`)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 16 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 39655.33 ymin: 35966 xmax: 42940.57 ymax: 38622.37
Projected CRS: SVY21 / Singapore TM
  OBJECTID SUBZONE_NO     SUBZONE_N SUBZONE_C CA_IND PLN_AREA_N PLN_AREA_C
1      189          2 TAMPINES EAST    TMSZ02      N   TAMPINES         TM
     REGION_N REGION_C          INC_CRC FMEL_UPD_D   X_ADDR   Y_ADDR SHAPE_Leng
1 EAST REGION       ER 21658EAAF84F4D8D 2014-12-05 41122.55 37392.39   10180.62
  SHAPE_Area                       geometry PreSch Count
1    4339824 MULTIPOLYGON (((42196.76 38...           72
```


:::
:::


Use *st_area* to get the area of each planning subzone, then use *mutate* to calculate the density of pre-schools in each subzone.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz3414$Area <- mpsz3414 %>%
  st_area()
mpsz3414 <- mpsz3414 %>%
  mutate(`PreSch Density` = `PreSch Count`/Area*1000000)
```
:::


## Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)

### Histogram


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(mpsz3414$`PreSch Density`)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Histogram with better visualisation


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=mpsz3414, 
       aes(x= as.numeric(`PreSch Density`)))+
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 color="black", 
                 fill="light blue") +
  labs(title = "Are pre-school even distributed in Singapore?",
       subtitle= "There are many planning sub-zones with a single pre-school, on the other hand, \nthere are two planning sub-zones with at least 20 pre-schools",
      x = "Pre-school density (per km sq)",
      y = "Frequency")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-19-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Scatterplot


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=mpsz3414, 
       aes(y = `PreSch Count`, 
           x= as.numeric(`PreSch Density`)))+
  geom_point(color="black", 
             fill="light blue") +
  xlim(0, 40) +
  ylim(0, 40) +
  labs(title = "",
      x = "Pre-school density (per km sq)",
      y = "Pre-school count")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range
(`geom_point()`).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
